content: quote: Which reports? Do you have some sort of evidence to support that claim? Or is it one of those numerous claims regarding this subject that have been made that have no supporting facts? And here's another thing, even if its true so what! Two books written prior to the election address this: The Obama Nation by Jerome R Corsi ISBN-13: 9781416598060 Pub. Date: August 2008 and The Case Against Barack Obama: The Unlikely Rise and Unexamined Agenda of the Media's Favorite Candidate by David Freddoso ISBN-13: 9781596985667 Pub. Date: August 2008 both discuss this. I make no claims, the authors of these two best selling books do. While the facts presented are in question, I'd like to point out that there hasn't been a libel suit filed against either author by the President. So either the facts presented are true or he doesn't believe that defamation of his character has occurred by their printing. When you stated: quote: ...And his father was Kenyan, not Kenyan/Arab. At least try to get something right. I simply was pointing out that you might not have all your facts correct and that you seemed confused about Race vs. Nationality. As to the "so what" I agree, so what. I wouldn't have voted for him regardless. It's his policies I don't like, not the color of his skin. In the other definition of "Nationality" which means citizenship, those facts are in question, and will remain in question as long as there are lawsuits pending against him.
